comment.author: 40919519@N00
comment._content:
Just a thought...
If this is in the UK (London), why are all the vehicles driving on the wrong side of the road?
They should be on the left hand side, not the right...

comment.author: 34903742@N07
comment._content: I guess the transparency was scanned the wrong way round. Simple to flip over to get it all correct. The road markings, signage and buildings do look typically British.

comment.author: 22694125@N02
comment._content: Congratulations! This is a wonderful shot! You are invited to post it to: artland

comment.author: 54935919@N03
comment._content:
Definitely a reversed image. If you're familiar with the local geography then you are facing west towards Hanger Lane: the spur off the roundabout should be to the south not the north as here.
Having said all that the traffic driving on the wrong side of the road is a dead giveaway.

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: The traffic is indeed a dead giveaway. (Well spotted everyone). Duly flipped.

comment.author: 52616733@N08
comment._content: Gran fotografía y muy linda construcción !!!

comment.author: 8104271@N03
comment._content:
Westway to the world!  I can hear The Clash in the background:

..."I'm up and down the Westway, in and out the lights
What a great traffic system - it's so bright
Can't think of a better way to spend the night
Than speeding around underneath the yellow lights..."
                                             
                                             (London's Burning, 1977.)
